title: Data Scientist

details:
Req ID: 16402
Shift: Days
Employment Status: AF - Active - Regular - Full Time 


Job Summary

The Data Scientist will join an internationally recognized group at the Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia working to transform the health of children. He or she will work within a dynamic team of data scientists, programmers, and researchers as part of PEDSnet (https://www.pedsnet.org), the Research Institute’s Applied Clinical Research Center, and the Philadelphia-region Pediatric Big Data project to understand predictors of childhood diseases, improve the quality of children’s healthcare, and rapidly advance knowledge through the creation and development of learning health systems. The Data Coordinating Center’s focus is on developing informatics methods to standardize health data from diverse sources, and make intelligent use of the data to produce new and actionable knowledge about child health.  Our work is funded by the National Institutes of Health, the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality, the Patient Centered Outcomes Research Institutes, and the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.


Job Responsibilities

Job Responsibilities:
Make effective use of rich data from multiple sources for large-scale projects. Collaborate with researchers regarding the capacity of data to meet their research needs and perform feasibility assessments as needed.
Provide researchers with analytic datasets and results that are crafted to address research needs and minimize privacy risk. Work with complex clinical data and extract information precisely targeted to researcher needs.
Participate in knowledge discovery in pediatric biomedical research, using analytic and data visualization techniques spanning heterogeneous and complex data types under direct supervision.
With guidance, contribute to the experimental design, execution, testing and critical evaluation of analytic methods as needed for observational, interventional, predictive, and population research projects.
Participate in activities such as data linkage, data quality assessment, statistical analyses and machine learning to interpret detailed clinical, environmental, and experiential data, and related tasks as needed.
Implement computational methods for test and evaluation; interpret data to assess performance.
Incorporate software development and data stewardship best practices into work.
Participate in communication of analytic methods, implementation, and results to varied audience of clinicians, scientists, analysts, and programmers.
Act as liaison with regulatory and other groups as part of collaborative research efforts.
Respond to data requests and conduct data consultations as necessary with community of researchers and other stakeholders interested in leveraging ‘big data’ to improve the health of children.
Contribute to manuscript writing for results publication, author abstracts, and present at professional conferences.


Required Education and Experience

Required Education and Experience BS/BA required
MS preferred in Informatics, Epidemiology, Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field. Alternately equivalent experience in data analysis and predictive modeling will be considered in lieu of relevant degree.
Non-degree graduate coursework such as a graduate certificate in Informatics, Analytics, Statistics, or Data Science is a plus.
Zero to five years of experience with progressively more complex data science, applied statistics, machine learning, or mathematical modeling projects.


Preferred Education, Experience & Cert/Lic

Preferred Education:
MS preferred in Informatics, Epidemiology, Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field.
Non-degree graduate coursework such as a graduate certificate in Informatics, Analytics, Statistics, or Data Science is a plus.
Zero to five years of experience with progressively more complex data science, applied statistics, machine learning, or mathematical modeling projects.
Additional Technical Requirements
Experience and demonstrated ability acquiring new technical/analytic skills and domain knowledge to support successful contribution to research and development projects is required.
Experience with relational databases (e.g., Postgres) required.
Experience with statistical software packages (e.g., R) required.
Experience with working with large and complex data required. Ability to translate research questions into executable code, customize queries or code as needed to adjust for data quality and other known issues within database, and review results for face and construct validity is required.
Optionally, experience writing code in a general purpose programming languages such as Python, Perl, Go is a plus.
Strong verbal and written communications skills with the demonstrated ability to explain complex technical concepts to a lay audience.
Experience creating informative visualizations for complex, high dimensional data preferred.
Understanding of software development practices such as version control, code review, and testing and packaging of code.

Additional Technical Requirements

Experience and demonstrated ability acquiring new technical/analytic skills and domain knowledge to support successful contribution to research and development projects is required.
Experience with relational databases (e.g., Postgres) required.
Experience with statistical software packages (e.g., R) required.
Experience with working with large and complex data required. Ability to translate research questions into executable code, customize queries or code as needed to adjust for data quality and other known issues within database, and review results for face and construct validity is required.
Optionally, experience writing code in a general purpose programming languages such as Python, Perl, Go is a plus.
Strong verbal and written communications skills with the demonstrated ability to explain complex technical concepts to a lay audience.
Experience creating informative visualizations for complex, high dimensional data preferred.
Understanding of software development practices such as version control, code review, and testing and packaging of code.

This position is entry level with 1-2 years of experience preferred. Ability to use higher level Excel functions (pivot tables, VLOOKUPS) is required. Responsibilities
Assists manager in resolving critical issues for clients by researching and gathering information about payment transactions and other relevant items as requested. 
Prepares abstracts and edits them for accuracy.
Edits narratives to support computer generated reports.
Provides narratives on monthly variance reports. Provides analysis and interpretation of information to clients.

Assists with the design of reports utilizing a variety of software tools. 
Prepares and distributes critical date reports. 
Creates and maintains client lease files ensuring they contain current, accurate information.

Performs other duties as assigned.

1-3 years of experience in corporate accounting or finance position
Ability to comprehend and interpret business documents and respond effectively to sensitive issues.
Requires in-depth knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations.
Experience with using higher level Excel functions (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPS)
Must possess the ability to multi task with high attention to detail

details:
Business Analyst- Finance/Peoplesoft
3 month Contract to Hire
Kansas City, MO
Conversion Salary $90K

   JOB DUTIES  1.Responsible for ensuring an efficient and smooth production environment for assigned system(s) by applying patches and fixes to system or working with the developer upon failure of system. Responsible for ensuring the least amount of downtime or inefficient production for assigned system(s). 2.Use in-depth understanding of system to write reports for users and/or clients from system(s) which aid in business decision making. 3.Develop and conduct user training on system(s) functionality. 4.Work with internal users to understand system needs and develop plans for meeting those needs. 5.Assist in large scope projects or lead activities in small to medium scope projects during analysis, design, construction and testing phases of projects. 6.Facilitate in requirements and design sessions for smaller to medium scope projects and participate in the requirements and design sessions for large scope projects. 7.Define and document functional and system specifications. 8.Develop process flows, system flows, and data models using modeling and process tools. 9.Prioritize system and data functionality requirements based on user needs and project constraints. 10.Review design documentation with users and developers. 11.Work with vendors and vendor packages to ensure that system requirements are understood. 12.Write test plans and test cases in compliance with relevant organizational and industry standards. 13.Creates clearly documented defect reports that enable a developer or technician to recreate the defect. May clear defect reports. 14.Maintain and update test documentation, user guides, release notes, and help notes to ensure accuracy of applications and related documentation. 15.Executes end-to-end functional tests and utilizes automated tests developed by others to exercise system. Collaborates to achieve end-to-end product and process quality. 16.Information, analysis and recommendations to support the product. 17.Understands the business needs the product is trying to meet and applies this understanding to guide testing. Applies a comprehensive understanding of the product functions and the marketplace in which it is sold effectively test assigned products  The Business Analyst (BA) will contribute to IT business or sponsored technology projects by translating basic to complex business needs into understandable requirements. BA's participate in the development and management of project plans related to application development initiatives, from project planning (business and strategic) and design, through testing, implementation, and maintenance. The BA has a considerable understanding of current and emerging IT products, services, processes, and methodologies, along with a continuing understanding of the business function and process. They are able to understand business requirements, goals, and risks, in order to formulate and define the technical scope and objectives of projects. BA's are also responsible for educating project team members and the business community on the impact of the proposed technology and for developing contingency plans. The BA has a team orientation and is focused at all times on improving business operations.


Additional Skills:  PeopleSoft Financials (GL/AP/FA/nVision)

details:
The following opportunity is available in the Orlando, FL facility for the Fuzing & Precision Products Division. 

Senior Operations Project Analyst – Req. #7403
 
DUTIES:
 
Work under the direction of the Director of Operations or designee with minimum supervision. The ideal candidate will have a passion for business operations and experience in finance.  Responsible for the coordination of schedules, operations initiatives, and financial/material data related activities for all KPP Operations in Orlando and Middletown locations.   This position will provide support to other departments by maintaining accurate records and supplying required schedules and status reports and driving tasks to completion in a timely manner; exercise independent judgment with regard to resolution of problems and interaction with other departments.   Demonstrating capabilities include:  problem solving, taskmaster, and motivation.  Provide support to management by maintaining accurate and detailed status of work in process, forecasts and future resource requirements. Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Perform diversified analytical duties related to the identification and resolution of materiel management problems related to materials budget, schedule changes and materials cost etc.
Coordinate with Engineering, Purchasing and other groups to resolve problems and make special arrangement for unusual situations in order to meet program schedules and goals.
Proactively identify and resolve problems/issues that may involve the gathering of cost, coordination of disposition of material (including fuzes) and filing claims.
Use project/program management skills to maintain and ensure execution of Integrated Master Schedule (IMS) for assigned program(s) to enable production to meet the objectives of the site:  on time delivery, planned past due, and maximized use of manufacturing resources.
Represent operations in monthly controls review with senior leadership and be able to collect, analyze and supply data to be reported in these reviews.
Lead the Operations organization in the management of the Estimates at Completion (EAC) process activities for the management of material for all KPP programs. Ensure all planning parameters related to materials cost are accurate, current and continuously adjusted to support the EAC processes.
Be involved in implementing new systems, procedures and work instructions, and special projects supporting manufacturing and customer service objectives.
Interact with the Program Managers to ensure factory visibility to forecasted customer demand, noting early indicators and taking subsequent actions to resolve and restore schedule and cost, identify and analyze risks as necessary.
Interface with Supervisors, Production Control, Operations Manager, Performance Improvement Engineers and Manufacturing Engineering to assure the master production schedule is within cell capacity constraints.
Coordinate with the Materials Master Scheduler to ensure integration of production schedules.
Create dashboard metrics to focus management awareness and actions.  Ensure operations execution is accomplished to meet facility commitments and goals.
Coordinate the capital planning process; ensuring budgets are met while identifying and prioritizing risks and opportunities to the plan.
Manage the IDWA process while identifying risks/opportunities to the plan. Present IDWA change scenarios to stakeholders along with recommendations for change.
Coordinate development of operations departmental budgets, material receipts plan, inventory plans and other miscellaneous forecasts while communicating any predictable changes in these forecasts to finance and upper management
Participate in program status reviews and new program planning meetings.
Work in a collaborative environment to ensure production readiness by communicating goals to all project stakeholders
Manage the Capital Equipment Request (CER) Activity
Manage the SIOP/Production SIOP Process for both Orlando and Middletown
Maintain company standards for quality
Exercise safe work habits
 


 

 

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE:  

Broad knowledge of cost accounting/control.  Thorough knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, database and presentation software application skills, as well as fluent written and oral communication skills.  General finance knowledge sufficient to support the business group’s current and near term requirements.  Bachelor’s degree in a finance or related business discipline.  The ability to effectively influence cross functional teams. 7 – 10 years of related project management experience.


Interested candidates, please apply using link below:

https://www.hrapply.com/kaman/AppJobView.jsp?link=7403&page=AppJobList.jsp&op=reset

EOE Poster Link

http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

 

Reasonable Accommodation Requests

 

Qualified individuals with a disability have the right to request a reasonable accommodation.  If you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our careers website as a result of your disability, request a reasonable accommodation by: (1) sending an e-mail to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] or calling 407-282-1000 (2) informing us regarding the nature of your request and (3) providing your contact information. Please do not direct any other general employment related questions to this email and/or phone number. Only inquiries concerning a request for a reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address and/or phone number.

 

 
ITAR Regulations

 

For more than 70 years, Kaman Precision Products, a division of Kaman Aerospace Group, has been a leader in the development and manufacture of safing and arming solutions for the ordnance and other industries.

 

All positions at Kaman Aerospace Group require access to information, or technology that is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and other US government security regulations.  These laws do not permit access rights to non-US citizens, or to other unauthorized individuals.  Therefore, presently, all applicants must be US Citizens, or US Permanent Residents (“green card holders”), and/or otherwise comply with ITAR requirements for access rights, to be considered for a position.  

 

All solicitations and advertisements for employees must state that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their protected veteran or disabled status and will not be discriminated against.

details:
Asia  global  Asset Management, buy-side company seeks bilingual Japanese-English  AVP level candidate to support Fixed Income Team

Candidates having experience credit research for rating agency or financial institution would be desirable and suitable, while a person in this position will be assigned for trading and other investment related works.

Primary duty for this position is following.
1) Credit Analyst: 40-50%
Assist the credit analysts and learn how to perform the internal credit analysis for credit investment
Learn how to make decision of investing corporate bond
Recommend investment idea across sectors.
Create quarterly / Monthly / weekly / reports for credit and EM
2) Trading : 25%
Execute trade accurately, based on the fixed income trade procedure
Prepare the trade for fixed income accounts
(Credit, MBS, EM and all fixed income related securities)
Process the trade and follow up the settlement
Analyze the trade results for portfolio managers
Execute Equity trade procedure and FX trade when it is needed (less frequent)
3) Portfolio manager support: 25%
Update risk management data and prepare the periodical reports
Check portfolio guideline
Support to maintain risk monitoring tools
Provide regular risk monitoring and report to portfolio manager when irregularities were found
Support to prepare the marketing materials
Prepare portfolio data and report to portfolio managers
Report monthly performance analysis to portfolio managers
Support to create monthly / quarterly / semi-annual reports to clients
Support to create sample portfolio
Prepare setup and liquidate funds (Arrange within U.S. internally and coordinate with Tokyo and London.)
Installation of new fixed income trading system (probably Aladdin)
Transition from Point to Port
Other fixed income related work

Assist the team on special projects to help the team meet its objectives and goals

Prepare market data requested by anyone
Assist the team on regulation-related matters

- Excellent written and oral communication skills in English (Japanese preferred)
- Credit research experience is preferred

- Good communication skills and understanding the importance of teamwork
- Having strong passion and diligent to investment related job

details:
Our client is currently seeking a DATA SCIENTIST - INTERMEDIATE   
Job Description: 
The Data Scientist will play a key role in delivering innovative scientific breakthroughs by applying predictive analytics, machine learning and statistics to product recommendations. You will work closely with interdisciplinary scientists and stakeholders to predict product performance and provide personalized seed prescriptions for growers while developing novel analytical models and best practices for complex data analyses.

Responsibilities: 
Design and prototype models with artificial intelligence, operations research, machine learning, and statistics in order to solve challenging analytics problems influencing farmer decisions 
Collaborate with Engineers to automate analytical models and deliver value @ scale 
Conduct scientific presentations regularly with leadership teams 

Basic Qualifications 

PhD or Masters in Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline with a focus on operations research or optimization 

At least 1 year research experience in applications of operations research 

At least 1 year experience with R programming 

At least 1 year experience with CPLEX or other solvers 

At least 1 year experience with MILP and/or MIQCP 

Ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, precise and actionable manner 

Preferred Qualifications: 

Ability to implement new algorithms efficiently and rigorously 

At least three year research experience with operations research 

At least one year research experience with modeling language such as CPLEX and AMPL 

At least three year experience with R programming 

Knowledge and experience in plant biology, breeding, agronomy or genetics  

Must Haves:

At least 1 year operations research experience. More experience on operations research is preferred. Excellent R coding skill sets.

A PhD, preferably in Operations Research, Statistics, math or computer science is highly desired. If the individual only has a Master’s Degree, they must have at least 1 year of real world experience. 

A PhD and academic experience will suffice.

Candidate should have at least 1 year of experience with 'R' or Matlab.  1 year+ experience with CPLEX, GAMS, PUN, AMPL or other solvers experience. 

Requires 1 yr. of experience with MILP and/or MIQCP.

Will work on Optimizations, Mathematical formulations, improvement to formulations.

details:
Internet Research Analyst

I am working with a global technology and research organization that is growing in the Dallas market. This is a fast-paced company that offers growth opportunity in an evolving field.

Job Summary:

 

Intellectual property is an extremely valuable asset and must be vigorously protected. When creating a new brand, logo or advertising, companies have professionals help them do research to see if this future IP is viable for use and possibly to protect and register in the U.S. or maybe around the world. In this job, you would work with law firms and Fortune 500 companies and learn how to conduct research to identify any potentially confusing and conflicting marks that are owned by others. You would learn how to become an expert in research focused on intellectual property clearance. This is an extremely valued skill set and a skill set that could be the basis for a great, long-term career.

Position:

 

·         A day in the life of a Trademark Research analyst consists of analyzing brand and company data to compile trademark clearance reports for clients. Daily tasks involve searching public and proprietary databases to identify similar trademarks and organizing the trademarks according to relevancy.

·         Previous knowledge of trademarks or intellectual property is not required. We will provide training, including trademark law theory and use of proprietary online systems.

·         Candidates should be computer savvy with strong internet research, analytical and language skills and should have proven ability to work independently and efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

·         Some customer interaction may be required.

·         Monday – Friday, regular business hours + overtime

·         Base Salary

·         PTO

·         Benefits

 

Requirements:


Associates degree required, BA preferred. 
Second language preferred but not required. 
Must have unrestricted authorization to work in US 
Analytical 

Good understanding of technology  


WHAT CANDIDATES SAY ABOUT THIS RECRUITER:
I was very impressed with Nate’s attention to detail and making sure I had as much information and guidance as possble prior to my phone interview. His comments helped understand the employer’s perspective better.Bruce, Chief Operating Officer in Kentucky

details:
Real Estate Research Analyst / Title Research Analyst - Florida – WORK FROM HOME/REMOTELY!!!  Bonus potential, benefits & PTO

Do you have years of real estate closing and/or title research experience in the State of Florida but are tired of doing the same thing and want more control over your calendar and have the opportunity to work remotely from your home office? Are you naturally organized and detailed oriented and enjoy solving problems? If the above sounds like you, then our client, a well-established claims management company located in Roswell, GA has a newly created position of Real Estate Research Analyst / Title Research Analyst – Florida that could be a great fit for you.  Our client has a very big presence in the State of Florida and they are seeking a qualified candidate that currently resides in Florida to work remotely to perform these duties.  Our client has identified millions of dollars worth of unclaimed property and the key to this position is to apply your knowledge of real estate to successfully manage the claims process. You will also help the client build a "knowledge database" and define processes and procedures. There is also plenty of room for advancement combined with the flexibility to set your own schedule and work remotely from your home office.
Specific duties for the Real Estate Research Analyst / Title Research Analyst - Florida include:


Build a "claims management" checklist for each claim and understand the exact steps needed in order to manage all open items to have the claim approved and paid.


Provide outstanding Customer Service to claimants, internal resources as well as local government agencies.


Utilize and enhance the existing "knowledge database" for how to process real estate claims in various jurisdictions.


Utilize MS Office and industry-specific software to process information.




Requirements for the Real Estate Research Analyst / Title Research Analyst - Florida position:


2+ years of experience working in the real estate industry with a strong preference for candidates with experience as a paralegal, mortgage/loan processor, administrative assistant with closing document experience, or real estate title research. 


Must have excellent customer service skills and enjoy working with people. 


Must be very detail oriented and organized. It is critical that this individual be “self-motivated" and be able to work autonomously.  


A college degree is highly preferred but not required. 


** Please note - the client highly encourages candidates with 20 to 30+ years of real estate experience to apply for this position. **

This position is responsible for supporting general treasury operations including performing daily cash and debt management, management of cash projections modeling and covenant reporting.
Perform daily cash management activities including cash positioning, execution of electronic payments, and daily reconciliation of cash activity 
Manage daily borrowing or pay-down levels including preparation of requisite benchmark rate conversion and renewal contract requests
Manage tracking of all debt instruments, including making recommendations for and   preparing benchmark rate conversion and renewal requests as needed
Manage cash highly-complex Excel-based forecasting model including weekly updates 
Prepare reporting for presentation to Treasurer, CFO and other management including weekly cash forecasting and other ad-hoc analysis 
Prepare weekly cash activity reconciliations and monthly bank reconciliations including identification and investigation of unreconciled and/or unusual items
Prepare monthly interest expense accrual for submission to Accounting
Verify weekly wire and ACH batches for accuracy between accounts payable and banking systems
Assist with compliance reporting for debt instruments covenants
Manage day-to-day banking relationships, including resolution of all issues that arise with both corporate and store level issues
Manage day-to-day armored carrier relationships, including resolution of all issues that arise with both corporate and store level issues 
Assist with issuance of letters of credit 
Adhere to appropriate checks and balances to maintain proper controls, maintain necessary transaction records and other required backup, and provide audit support for cash and debt related activity as needed 
Assist with roll out of treasury related programs and design/implementation of process improvements as necessary



Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting required
At least one plus years’ treasury experience coupled with two plus years of other accounting/finance experience
Strong analytical and financial modeling skills
Knowledge of accounting principles and strong analytical skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Advanced level in Excel)
title: Senior Treasury Analyst - to $75k

details:
Our client, a large Digital Security company, is currently seeking a Senior Taxonomist for a 3+ month temporary position with the opportunity for a slight extension.  The position is located in Plano, Texas OR Santa Clara, California OR Hillsboro, Oregon.By working for our client, you will be exposed to a large private company that develops digital security tools for PC’s, servers & mobile devices, work for a firm with over 6,000 employees, work in a fast paced corporate environment and be an integral part to the Data team.In addition to working with the world’s most recognized and trusted name in staffing, Kelly employees can expect:-      Competitive pay-      Paid holidays-      Year-end bonus program-      Recognition and incentive programs-      Access to continuing education via the Kelly Learning Center The hours for this position are as follows
 Monday to Friday 8:00am-5:00pm

Pay Rate= $76.00-$87.59/hour Your responsibilities will include (but not limited to):
 Focus on planning, designing, and implementing a metadata management process to achieve strategic business goals
 Create data models (conceptual, logical, physical), data flow diagrams, taxonomic models, metadata management designs, and vocabulary standards
 Suggesting, upholding, and championing taxonomy and classification standards and a governance model 
 Implementing the team’s taxonomy strategies and vision, driving execution of roadmaps and project plans to continually improve and creating a single source of truth 
 Identifying toolset gaps and potential gaps 
 Identifying a taxonomy or knowledge management system to use
 Facilitating and closing recommendations for terminology management. 
 Researching and documenting new terms or edits to existing terminology in keeping with taxonomy architecture and standards, providing full term metadata including use instructions, examples, explanations, and reference information 
 Ensuring taxonomy additions, edits, and deprecation are fully executed within the Tools per standard procedures 
 Executing and enhancing taxonomy and classification metrics and reporting program elements 
 Coordinating with user research partners to run and analyze surveys, card sorts, and tree tests to inform taxonomy changes
 Being a peer leader with business and technical stakeholders to find solutions and resolve taxonomy and classification issues in creative and intelligent ways 
 Leading classification audit and review as needed 

You are required to have a Master’s Degree in Library Science and 5+ years of experience in taxonomy & metadata.  You will possess excellent time management & organizational skills, self-motivation, analytical skills, research skills and excellent communication skills. These software’s will be a strong asset (JIRA, Confluence, GitHub, Visio).**Important information:  This position is recruited for by a remote Kelly office, not your local Kelly branch.  If you have questions about the position, you may contact the recruiter recruiting for this position, [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] however, your resume should be uploaded via the “SUBMIT RESUME” button included within**

details:
Responsibilities 


Analyze historical and projected financial and operational information, with the goal of delivering actionable recommendations for improvement to operations.


Assist the monthly financial review process, at the practice level with local leaders. 


Proforma development, financial modeling, valuation analysis, and other complex business modeling.


Makes recommendations for improvement of financial reporting, business modeling, budgeting, and other company financial processes.


Works closely with the finance manager in developing and finalizing the sub-region budgets. This includes assisting with developing the budget project plan, coordinationg resources, timelines, validating the integrity of the data. 


Interface with key executives and physician leaders, and liaise with operating locations on various financial and operational issues. Works well in a matrix environment.

Supports Directors of Operations in various projects, data analytics and variance explanations.



Prepare variance analysis in preparation for financial reviews with operating locations. Prepares monthly variance analysis for each sub-region.



Qualifications 


Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance required.


5-7 years of experience required


Operations Finance experience required.


Excellent oral, written, listening, and presentation skills and ability to clearly articulate complex information to others.


Strong attention to detail, demonstrated integrity and professionalism.


Proven ability to perform under deadlines and to adjust plans to meet changing needs and requirements.

Structured thinking. 



Strong customer service focus. 



Hardware/Software:

Proficiency in Excel.


Strong working knowledge of basic office and PC applications, including MS Word and Powerpoint.


Familiarity with Business Intelligence software (Cognos, Hyperion, Business Objects). 


Familiarity with large scale ERP or G/L package (SAP, Oracle, and Microsoft).


Experience with financial and accounting reporting systems.
title: Sr Financial Analyst

details:
Senior Financial Analyst 
Primary Functions:


Responsible for providing analytical support by reviewing and reporting the overall financial health of the organization and ensuring that all financial data is correct. 


Duties and Responsibilities:


Report monthly, quarterly, biannual, and annual profits and provide analytical review (i.e. budget vs estimates vs actuals reports), feedback, and recommendations to the Finance Manager and/or Executive Management Team


The development and maintenance of strategic and analytical dashboards that give insight into the company’s financial health and enhance the ability to measure KPIs in the organization.


Development of business cases (including ROI) for Customer and Consultant incentives including bundles, specials, national / international trip and national conference qualification. Reporting on results of each initiative compared to initial plan.


Collaboration with project and business process owners to develop and maintain key business cases for projects and continuous improvement initiatives.


Automate reporting and forecasting tools.


Guide cost analysis process by creating and documenting procedures.


Market and business intelligence research, when requested


Work closely with all members of finance team to ensure accurate financial reporting and decision support


Perform daily general ledger accounting




Candidate Profile:



Education: Bachelor’s Degree - Accounting, Finance, or related field


Experience: 5-7 years working as a Senior Financial Analyst, Financial Analyst, or a similar position in the field of accounting/finance


Strong research and analysis skills


Knowledge of GAAP, IFRS, and other related accounting law or standards


High proficiency with the use of Microsoft Office, especially with Excel and Power-Point


Comfortable to identify and act on priorities in a fast-paced work environment


Excellent communication skills - Both verbal and written


Willing to provide open and honest feedback with the aim to improve organizational processes


Fundamental understanding of ERP systems and related data structures


Project management experience, not required, but a plus


Relevant certifications, (e.g. CFA) not required, but a plus

details:
HealthTECH Resources is seeking a Cerner Revenue Cycle Applications Analyst for a direct hire FTE position at a renowned health care organization in Florida.
What are the main duties of the Cerner Revenue Cycle Applications Analyst?

Primary responsibilities include design, build, validation, implementation, and maintenance of Revenue Cycle application software using Cerner build tools.
Provides ongoing analysis, training and functional support for Revenue Cycle applications.
Creates and maintains detailed test plans and scripts.
Participates in testing efforts and ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported and resolved in a timely manner.
Responsible for identifying and implementing system solutions that support improved workflows, reduce manual intervention, eliminate rework and increase efficiencies related to Revenue Cycle.
Manages incidents and requests that have been assigned through the IT Service Management System which includes the change management process.

Why work here?

This is a nationally recognized health care organization with state of the art facilities and innovative technology solutions.
A collaborative, supportive atmosphere that allows you feel that you are helping to make a real difference in the lives of people others.



Minimum of 5 years healthcare experience as an Analyst or equivalent role configuring revenue cycle software required.
Experience in one or more of the following revenue cycle functions required: Patient Accounting, Patient Access, Charge Capture or Patient Financial Services.
Experience with CDM structure for professional and technical charges and methodology that supports charge capture within Cerner applications required.
Knowledge of Patient Accounting integration with Lawson, 3M, MedeAnalytics and MedAssets required.
Hands-on experience gathering and documenting user requirements, performing design/build, writing/executing test scripts and performing ongoing maintenance and support required.
Strong Cerner Millennium Revenue Cycle related application experience.

title: Financial Analyst - 2

details:
The Company
Our client is a $2+ billion manufacturer with 70 locations and more than 4,800 people in 25 countries. We’re seeking a FP&A Analyst eager to join an established yet rapidly growing, industry-leading company with over 100 years of history. This organization has won numerous “best of” awards for innovation, and has been named one of the best places to work in Charlotte for the last 5 years. 
 
The Role: 
This role is an additional headcount for the FP&A team to increase analytic and process support to the organization.  It is a highly visible role with significant career growth opportunities. This position interacts extensively with other functions and thus requires an ability to build and sustain relationships while ensuring business partners are successful in their contributions to cross-functional processes.  
 
·        Develop and maintain value-add reporting and dashboards including mill, customer, and product profitability.  Present results routinely and identify areas of risk and opportunity.
·        Provide forecasting and planning oversight – working with cross-functional teams to validate inputs, drive for consensus, and analyze variances.
·        Stay informed of macro trends that could impact forecasting and planning and use to improve justification and accuracy. 
·        Perform complex analytics and modeling that may include profitability optimization, scenario analysis, cap ex business cases, or product line innovation.
·        Leverage IT to drive value across the organization (Oracle BI, Host Analytics, Tableau, etc.) - includes design documents, data management, testing, training, and maintenance.
·        Compile quarterly BOD decks, leadership updates, and other presentations as needed.  
·        Provide analytical decision support for cross-functional teams including S&OP, purchasing, and product management.
·        Assist with the annual long range strategic planning and OP&B compilation, reporting, and analysis. 

The Candidate
The ideal candidate will have a thorough knowledge of financial concepts and possess strategic business acumen which can be leveraged to create value.  The candidate should also have enthusiasm for leveraging IT to create tools that are user-friendly and value-added to benefit our expanding business.
 
·        Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, or Accounting required; MBA is preferred
·        Strong record of achievement (GPA, promotions, awards/accolades)
·        Prior experience in Corporate Finance, Investment Banking, Consulting or Private Equity
·        Strong financial modeling skills including full financial statement output
·        Analytical and creative problem-solving skills
·        Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills 
·        Experience with business intelligence tools 
·        Great written and verbal communication skills
·        Keen attention to detail and commitment to quality
·        Comfortable with multi-tasking and flexible when needed
·        Sense of urgency and adherence to deadlines
·        Performs well under pressure and maintains a positive outlook
·        Results-oriented self-starter and team-player

details:
A global manufacturing company is looking to build out their finance team adding a financial analyst to their corporate finance team. The Financial Analyst provides leadership, analytical support and guidance on key business decisions, finance issues and projects to all areas of the business.In addition to following policies and procedures, principal accountabilities include, but are not limited to:
Developing financial models, diagnostic tools and new analytical methods to interpret results, and optimize profit
Coordinating with all levels of the business, from other analysts to executive leadership and various departments, to assess needs for financial information, and develops reports, analyses, and tools to meet those needs
Assisting FP&A team and other departments in preparing annual budgets and strategic plans
Monitoring variances to plan throughout the year, forecasting results and presenting findings to appropriate parties
Presenting project results, recommendations, and solutions to all levels of leadership
Continuously look for and identifying opportunities in the business and presenting recommendations to leadership
Educating various departments and all levels of leadership on financial matters and policies
Utilizing multiple sources of data to extract, analyze, and report on various items including Sales, ROI on a project, performance based on certain key measures and G&A spend and makes recommendations based on findings

Excellent analytical, quantitative, written, and verbal communication skills

Ability to quickly react and respond to challenges in projects or the business
Ability to manage financial data in a confidential and professional manner

details: 6 month project doing research for a payer to figure out why they keep overpaying and getting refunds from a provider.They will review COB's and EOB's to determine primacy for the insurance (primary and secondary insurance identification).From there they will figure out how the claim was originally paid and where mistakes were made causing the overpayment.They will look at benefit eligibility, COB rules, determining primacy, navigate EOB's. They will also review correspondence about the claims and overpayments to see where they need to be routed? Scientific / Analytical
Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Data Scientist to join our team in the Northern VA area to provide unparalleled support to our internal organization and to begin an exciting and rewarding career within ManTech. Description:The Data Scientist shall utilize data science and development skills to automate manual analytic processes, generate analytic models, and enable analysts to exploit DHS and IC data holdings. The contractor shall establish advanced analysis and data visualization methodologies, models, and tools to derive intelligence outcomes and impacts. Technical developer skills required include, but are not limited to: Python, R, Java, JavaScript, PHP, Oracle, AngularJS, .NET, and Hadoop-related technologies. As technology and mission requirements change over the course of this contract, the need for some of these technologies may be lessened and the need for new or different skills may be required. The Contractor shall assist in the establishment of data visualization concepts to better represent insights. The Contractor shall assist in establishing capability to examine voluminous data sources. The Contractor shall assist the Government in applying innovative and big data-driven problem solving skills to analytic and operational elements of the IE. The Contractor shall provide services related to data visualization and communication of complex quantitative concepts to non-technical audiences. The Contractor will assist in mission data projects within DHS and with other US Government partners, as appropriate. The Contractor will apply specialized experience in statistics and machine learning algorithms (how to gather, clean, and appropriately use data in models that address DHS mission needs) as well as coding and data visualization skills. The contractor shall provide tailored communications to innovation stakeholders in meetings, demos, and other customer engagements. The contractor shall support analytic innovation, development, and data analytics activities to DHS customers, as well as forward-deployed full-time support to DHS Intelligence Enterprise Components throughout the National Capital Region. The Contractor shall assist in identifying threats to transportation through big data fusion using Department of Defense systems designed for data integration.Requirements: 
Must possess a Bachelor's Degree and 8 years of experience, years of experience can replace degree requirements.
Handles raw data (e.g. structured, unstructured, and mixed datasets), and analyzes data through the application of various statistical techniques or tools.
Familiar with programming languages such as, but not limited to: R, SAS, Python, MatLab, SQL, Hive, Pig, and Spark.
Experienced in working with and exploiting big data; distributed computing; predictive modeling; mathematics; statistics; machine learning; story-telling; and visualization.
Demonstrates ability to extract meaning from and interpret data using a variety of tools and methods from statistics and machine learning.
Ability to collect, clean, and mung data in a timely manner as part of a cross-functional team in an intelligence, or related, environment.
Possesses strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, including Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio, and Word.
Clearance:Must possess an active TS/SCI

BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math or equivalent. 7-9 years of relevant work experience. Proficiency in using R, Matlab, Python Scikit-learn or other statistical modeling packages, with a focus on machine learning; experience with NLP a plus. Proficiency in developing production systems for processing large volumes of structured and unstructured data in Java, Python or similar technology stack. Previous experience with Hadoop technology stack (Map reduce, HIVE/PIG, etc). Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong team player, capable of working collaboratively in customer teams.

details:
The UFG Enterprise Analytics Department is focused on delivering strategically-impactful results by building analytically based solutions that integrate a wide range of internal and external data assets. The ultimate objective of the Enterprise Analytics organization is to help UFG gain and maintain a competitive advantage in how it prices risk and identifies potential loss.
 
We are seeking a Senior Actuarial Analyst to drive the development of actuarial pricing, data analytic, and state filing projects for UFG’s Commercial Property & Casualty’s segment. This individual will work closely with Underwriters and Data Scientists to develop and implement pricing strategies that drive towards profitable growth of our P&C segment. The ideal candidate will possess strong technical and communication skills. We are looking for an individual who is internally motivated, intellectually curious, has the ability to manage multiple projects, and is driven to enhance existing processes.
 
The Senior Actuarial Analyst supports the pricing and reserving of new/renewal business and development of effective premium/rating structure and strategies in support of business objectives. Calculates profit margins on new and renewal business. Coordinates, prepares and performs actuarial analysis or analyzes loss and expense reserves. Provides consultation on actuarial models and risk issues. Supports Underwriters on pricing decisions. May oversee the work of less experienced actuaries.

This position must be based in our corporate headquarters in Cedar Rapids, IA. Relocation package is available.

Responsibilities Include:

Support the annual profitability review process
Lead junior actuaries in the review of portfolios’ historical financial performance as well as support the identification and quantification of underwriting actions
Communicate information and results to a variety of technical and non-technical audiences across the organization
Make informed actuarial recommendations based on professional judgment and experience; effectively challenge and/or escalate issues within business decisions or processes that are not able to be supported from an actuarial standpoint
Assist with preparation of rate and actuarial memorandums to support rate filing
Respond to objections and regulatory requests
Support experience and rate indication studies to assess rate adequacy
Support improvements efforts in order to increase consistency, efficiency, and compliance with internal standards
Collaborate with Underwriting in large account pricing
Assist with financial projections and reporting
Develop underwriting rating tools and engines
Support junior actuaries and provide mentorship as necessary
Other special projects




BS in Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Statistics or related field. Advanced degree preferred.
5+ years of related commercial P&C experience
ACAS or FCAS Designation Preferred
Skills with Excel, Power Point, SQL
Knowledge of SAS, R, and data visualization software a plus
Strong verbal and written communication skills
title: Sr. Actuarial Analyst

details:
UC San Diego
Financial Analyst
Filing Deadline: Wed 4/25/2018
Salary Range: $23.42 - $36.21 /hour

Under the general direction of the Strategic Financial Planning and Systems Manager, this position conducts planning and analysis for the Housing/Dining/Hospitality Department, involving detailed impact analysis, developing financial projections, formulating courses of actions and delivering presentations to HDH Associate Directors. Provides primary coordination and analytical support to the Financial Manager and Associate Directors on various major projects in support of the department’s new financial system.

This position also performs complex analysis related to budgeting and financial accounting, including forecasting, modeling, and policy administration. The incumbent performs analysis of the department’s historical budgetary and financial data and develops strategies, recommends and implements resolutions to ensure efficient fiscal management of the department’s resources using our new Financial System.

Housing Dining Hospitality (HDH) is a self-funded, large and complex campus department consisting of 7 divisions, with approximately 700 career employees, 1000 to 1200 student employees and an annual operating budget of greater than $170 million. HDH provides housing for approximately 15,000 undergraduates, grad students, faculty, staff and their families in over 400 buildings covering approximately 6 million sq. ft. HDH is in the midst of implementing an aggressive building plan which will add 5000 new beds and almost double our square footage by 2021.

Currently, HDH houses 38% of UCSD’s enrolled students with a goal of housing 50% in the near future. HDH provides maintenance and repair, contract meals/meal plan management, as well as retail food service, conference services and catering services to residents, students, faculty, staff, and campus visitors.


• Overtime may be required.

Apply Online
http://50.73.55.13/counter.php?id=128377


The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, gender identity or sexual orientation. For the complete University of California nondiscrimination and affirmative action policy see: www-hr.ucsd.edu/saa/nondiscr.html

QUALIFICATIONS
• Working knowledge of finance policies, practices, and systems. Knowledge and applications of principles and practices of fund accounting, cost analysis and audit procedures.
• Proven ability to analyze complex fiscal issues and information, recognize potential impact, identify alternative solutions and make recommendations.
• Ability to gather reasonably retrievable information to organize, and perform basic financial analysis assignments. Working knowledge of accounting and finance principles for budget planning and reconciling data discrepancies.
• Strong math skills with the ability to perform complex calculations and to prepare, develop, and analyze expense reports and projections for consistency and accuracy.
• Ability to effectively present information verbally and in writing clearly and concisely. Ability to produce high quality written reports, and other documents, that effectively communicate in a clear, organized and concise manner to senior campus management and others.
• Knowledge of not-for-profit financial reporting systems sufficient to comprehend Budget, Financial, Staffing and Payroll/Personnel and Student information systems.
• Strong skill in applying advanced computer technology as a problem-solving tool in financial modeling, analysis, budgetary management, and other administrative functions and situations. Advanced Microsoft Suite skills, specifically Excel. Strong ability to accurately process large volumes of data using pivot tables and databases.
• Strong ability using spreadsheet and database software for moderately complex financial analysis, fiscal management, and financial reports. Ability to research, collect, process, validate, and interpret financial and budgetary data from diverse sources such as the budget and operating ledger systems and Department financial reports.
• Conceptual knowledge to develop, design, modify and prepare financial reports for use by management for decision-making. Ability to design, adapt, implement or evaluate new procedures, systems and reports.
• Ability using organizational skills to multi-task in a high volume environment. Possess interpersonal human-relations skills to employ tact, diplomacy and flexibility Ability to adapt to changing priorities. Ability to prioritize heavy workload, meet deadlines, cope with peak work-load periods and apply creativity and originality in problem solving.
• Solid interpersonal skills at all levels within the unit; excellent service orientation and critical thinking skills; and attention to detail. Ability to function as a member of a team. Ability to successfully establish and maintain positive and goal-oriented working relationships.
• Intermediate knowledge and understanding of internal control practices and their impact on protecting University resources. Ability to perform detailed audits of budget, staffing and fund transfer data to ensure policy compliance and accuracy. Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion.
• BA/BS Degree from a 4-year university with a major in accounting, finance, economics, business administration, statistics, mathematics or an allied field, and two (2) years of experience in fiscal analysis or financial operations; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Ability to perform independently with minimal direction in unstructured situations and apply creativity and originality in problem solving. Ability to perform and produce quality work to meet HDH Associate Directors' expectations. Ability to independently follow through and to complete assignments.

SPECIAL CONDITIONS
• Job offer is contingent upon a satisfactory clearance based on background check results.

• If employee will be driving a University vehicle, must have current California driver's license, maintain good driving record and participate in the DMV pull program.

details:
Research Faculty (Flow Acoustics Engineer)Careers at the Applied Research Laboratory at the Pennsylvania State UniversityWE AreLocated in the heart of Happy Valley, State College, PA, The Applied Research Laboratory (ARL) at Penn State is an integral part of one of the leading research universities in the nation and serves as a University Center of Excellence in Defense science, systems, and technologies with a focus in naval missions and related areas. As a DoD-designated, U.S. Navy UARC (University Affiliated Research Center), ARL maintains a long-term strategic relationship with the U.S. Navy and provides support for other services. We are seeking a researcher to perform modeling and measurement research in the area of flow induced structural acoustics for a wide range of possible applications, including marine vehicles, aviation, and renewable and non-renewable energy production.WE OfferEmployment at ARL includes many benefits and rewards, including: Professional Development
 Career Advancement Opportunities
 75% Tuition Discount for you and your family
 Safe and Diverse Community
 College Sporting Event Mecca
 World-Class Entertainment Facilities and Events
 Cultural Events
 Good Public Education System
 Activities for All Stages of your Life What YOU Will DoYou will: Using advanced instrumentation, prepare and conduct experiments at ARL as well as various off-site government testing facilities; identify and perform appropriate numerical and analytical modeling; write and submit proposals for funded research; cultivate relationships with existing and potential government and industry sponsors; collaborate with other research and academic faculty at Penn State; and document research activities in technical reports and peer reviewed publications.What YOU Need to be SuccessfulNon-tenure faculty rank will be commensurate with education level and experience. Minimum requirements include a PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or Acoustics plus three years of related work experience.Preferred experience:
 Knowledge of vibration measurements, modal analysis techniques, finite element, and boundary element analysis
 Familiarity with data acquisition systems and data acquisition system development
 Proficiency in programming within the MATLAB environment and in a compiled language such as C/C++ or FORTRAN
 Familiarity with government research programs and the proposal submission process.Required experience/skills:
 Expertise in flow excitation mechanisms, such as gust response and turbulent boundary layer excitation, and the relation of these forces to vibration and radiated sound
 Good written and verbal communication skills
 The ability to work independently and meet project schedule requirements
 The ability to work effectively in a team environment
 Occasional domestic and international travel will be required to support testing.You will be subject to a government security investigation and you must be a U.S. citizen to apply. Employment with the Applied Research Laboratory will require successful completion of a pre-employment drug screen. This is a one-year, fixed-term renewable appointment.FOR FURTHER INFORMATION on other positions at ARL, visit our web site at http://www.arl.psu.edu.Apply online at https://psu.jobs/job/75827CAMPUS SECURITY CRIME STATISTICS: For more about safety at Penn State, and to review the Annual Security Report which contains information about crime statistics and other safety and security matters, please go to http://www.police.psu.edu/clery/, which will also provide you with detail on how to request a hard copy of the Annual Security Report.Penn State is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.Copyright ©2017 Jobelephant.com Inc. From innovation labs to fresh new products and services, we deliver value at every turn. Working with clients, we explore new approaches to critical business issues. Our assets based consulting agenda is designed to deliver tangible results in the near-term and sustainable competitive advantage for years to come.Our innovation lab or “iLab” is the leading edge product development center for Deloitte Consulting; focused on creating cloud-based software and advanced analytics products. The product portfolio spans multiple software technologies including wearables, machine learning and advanced analytics, social/mobile, and other leading edge technologies.Our strategy is to augment our leading services practice with software and analytics products that strike at the heart of our clients' business problems providing them with differentiated products. To do this, the iLab is built up of multiple teams including user experience/user interface designers, software architects and engineers, infrastructure and operations staff, testers and developers. details:
Opportunity: Real Estate Analyst
Location: Atlanta, GA
The RE Analyst is primarily responsible for conducting research, analysis, fieldwork, forecasting, and other related assessments to ensure financially sounds investments in acquisitions and dispositions. The RE Analyst assists in communication with capital partner during the acquisition process and coordinates all stages of transaction deliverables.

 Organization: Banyan Investment Group
Banyan Investment Group is a hotel investment and management that has appeared multiple times on Inc's list of fastest growing private companies in the United States. We currently have 16 properties in our hotel portfolio and offer a dynamic work environment with avenues for professional and personal growth. We strive to create a positive work environment where team members feel like they are part of family, receive a high level of respect, and are recognized for their merits and accomplishments.

We are seeking an individual who unequivocally embody our core values:
  
Transparent & Accountable
 
Humble, Respectful & Dedicated
 
Embrace Opportunity 
 
Create Value for Shareholders
 
Family Matters





Essential Job Functions
Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
●  Assists deal manager and executives on acquisition efforts including sourcing, transaction negotiations and execution, underwriting, investment committee efforts, and capital structuring.
●  Conducts primary market research and fieldwork including site tours and competitive hotel inspection.
●  Prepares written assessment of current economic conditions and lodging demand generators.
●  Prepares analysis of competitive set, including description of amenities, strengths, weaknesses, historical performance, marketing and sales strategies and market segments.
●  Provides summary of new supply and impact on revenue results and marketing efforts.
●  Prepares analysis of future demand projections and any new sources of demand.
●  Assists in formulating initial business positioning statements.
●  Generates ADR and occupancy projections.
●  Formulates analysis of market penetration.
●  Prepares report for final review and incorporation into the Investment Recommendation, Management Proposal or Feasibility Analysis.
●  Assists with capital sourcing efforts, inclusive of both debt and equity.
●  Assists with investment exit/sale analysis, providing recommendation internally and for capital investors.
●  Serves as primary interface with capital partners as company markets acquisition opportunities.
●  Prepares evaluation and analysis of partnership/waterfall/promote terms with capital partners.
●  Maintains responsibility for all stages of acquisition deal deliverables from identification of target asset to conducting the closing.



Minimum Qualifications
●  Thorough knowledge of the lodging industry as well as return on real estate investment principles.
●  Bachelor degree in real estate, finance, or business.
●  Possess superior communication skills, oral and written.
o  Diplomacy, tact, and a helpful, positive, professional presentation and attitude are required.
o  Fluent in technical financial language with ability to adeptly communicate in financial terms.
●  Self-motivated, well organized, and results driven professional. Ability to meet deadlines.
●  Highly computer literate and proficient in Microsoft Suite especially Excel.
●  Ability to work with financial concepts and perform financial analysis.


Compensation:

Total compensation will be commensurate with experience and will include a base salary, bonus, and benefits to include fully paid medical insurance for the team member.

details:
General Cigar Co. (GCC), one of the world's largest manufacturers and marketers of premium handcrafted cigars, seeks to hire an experienced Financial/Business Analyst.  The successful candidate will be a business partner with Supply Chain, performing general financial analysis, reporting, and monthly close activities for the Finance department.  
This position will be based at the Richmond corporate headquarters (Glen Allen, Virginia) and will require regular (±30%) travel to our Hampton, Virginia distribution center. 
The Analyst must have solid knowledge of finance and accounting, preferably with experience related to manufacturing and exposure to product costing.  This position reports to the Senior Manager, Budgeting & Financial Analysis.
 
Main Duties & Responsibilities: 


Conduct and analyze audits of product costs, and develop analysis/reports to evaluate item, brand, and customer profitability
Identify business risks and opportunities through analysis and asking the right questions
Perform month-end close activities and reconciliations
Drive simplification of Finance processes, and foster a culture of sharing best practices
Support the preparation of KPI’s and financial analysis used for Senior Leadership reviews
Work with Sales and Marketing departments to support product pricing exercise
Support the preparation of Governmental reporting
Support the preparation of annual budgets and quarterly forecasts
Perform ad-hoc reporting and analysis, and participate in special Finance projects

Essential requirements: 

Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Accounting
2+ years of financial experience (this is not an entry level position)
Excellent PC skills and experience using financial systems (preferably Oracle) plus Excel and PowerPoint
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Written and oral communication skills
Demonstrated ability to perform in an environment that emphasizes teamwork to meet deliverables
Demonstrated capacity to effectively manage multiple and frequently changing priorities
Demonstrated capability to meet strict deadlines with a high level of ownership and strong sense of urgency
Valid driver's license, acceptable driving record, and reliable motor vehicle
Able and willing to occasionally work extended hours; international travel (1-2 times per year) is possible
Ability to confidently work with Senior Management
Possession of a valid passport or ability to obtain one

Desirable requirements: 
Strong financial system acumenAbility to work with large volumes of dataSpanish as a second language is desirable but not required
 
 
What We Offer In Return:
General Cigar Company, Inc., offers highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive, flexible benefits program, including:
 

401(k) with Generous Company Match


Medical


Dental


Vision Care


Disability and Life Insurance


Tuition Assistance


Health Club Subsidy


Paid Vacation


12 Paid Holidays Annually

 


About General Cigar Co., Inc.


General Cigar Co., Inc., a division of Scandinavian Tobacco Group A/S (STG) headquartered in Denmark, manufactures and markets handcrafted cigars for the premium market. Committed to delivering cigars of the finest quality, General Cigar’s skilled artisans produce Macanudo, Cohiba, Partagas, Punch, CAO, Toraño, and other leading premium brands in the company’s Dominican, Honduran and Nicaraguan factories. 


 


General Cigar also operates Club Macanudo, a cigar bar in New York City. Based in Glen Allen, Virginia, General Cigar sells through tobacconists nationwide and also exports select products to numerous countries around the world.

details:
Clearance Requirement: TS/SCI Clearance Preferred

US Citizenship Required
BlackSky Geospatial Solutions, a division of Spaceflight Industries, is a geospatial intelligence solutions provider that enables organizations to task, collect, and transform data from earth observation, global sensor networks, mobile devices, and social media to deliver on-demand insights about places, events, and assets that are critical to their operations. Blacksky provides satellite collection, data, and cloud based -processing and analytic solutions to organizations that are capitalizing on the exponential growth of a wide range of sensor and collection platforms for delivering the next generation of GEOINT and location intelligence solutions. BlackSky has extensive expertise and capabilities in commercial remote sensing, multi-source analytics, cloud computing, open source software development, Amazon Web Services, and big data geospatial analytics. BlackSky provides solutions to commercial and government organizations with relevant programs with the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency (NGA), US. Army, and U.S. Air Force Research Labs. 
BlackSky is seeking innovative Senior Data ScientistS with a passion for unlocking new insights through disruptive big data analytics. As a member of our solutions team you will help drive our product and solutions strategy and formulate business solutions around time and space analytics. Successful candidate will possess hands on experience in working as a data scientist solving challenging business problems, bringing a strong background in exploiting next generation big data technologies to drive disruptive market solutions.
Responsibilities: 


Design and implement solutions for internal and external customers that exploit time space analytics for next generation business intelligence solutions 

Plan and conduct research projects related to data mining, content curation, machine learning, and predictive analytics 

Collaborate with management and technical team on product strategy 

Develop algorithms, models, and analytical tools for solving domain specific business problem 

Collaborate with software developers to plan and construct the architecture surrounding model deployment. 



Basic Qualifications:

5 to 15+ Years of experience as a data scientist
US Citizenship Required
PhD/Master's Degree or equivalent in one of the following fields: computer science, mathematics, statistics, or another computational area with a strong background of using machine learning/data mining for predictive modeling
Hands on experience working with very large data sets, including data cleansing/transformation, statistical analyses, and visualization.
Working knowledge of a wide range of data analysis concepts including: Natural Language Processing (5+ years), Text Clustering, Text Classification and Summarization, Probability and Statistics, Regression and Classification Algorithms, Graphical Models, Bayesian Analysis, Convolutional and Recurrent Neutral Networks, Unsupervised Learning Methods. 
Extensive experience developing software solutions including: Building novel algorithms in Python 3, NumPy, Scipy, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, Keras, NLTK, and SpaCy, develop asynchronous processing algorithms, Cloud-based solutions (especially AWS services like EC2 & S3), Implementing algorithms directly from research papers.
Experience performing research in both groups and as a solo effort.
Strong ability to communicate concepts and analytical results with customers, management, and the technical team, highlighting actionable insights.

Desired Skills and Experience:

Experience with mobile, geospatial or mapping technologies
Experience with big data technologies such as MongoDB (or other NoSQL data stores), Redis and ElasticSearch
title: Data Scientist

details:
Altair ProductDesign is a global, multi-disciplinary product development consultancy of more than 700 designers, engineers, scientists, and creative thinkers. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Altair Engineering, Inc. (www.altair.com), this cross-functional organization is best known for its leadership in combining human and machine creativity to fuel innovation, automate processes, and develop new methods. Altair ProductDesign firmly advocates a user-centered, team-based design approach, and utilizes proprietary simulation and optimization technologies to help clients bring innovative, profitable products to market faster.​
Duties 

Work with research team to identify the data requirements, available data source (internal and external such as geo-location specific or social media) and expected outcomes in Connected and Automated Vehicle (CAV) research and experiments 
Recommend and support data collection, integration and retention requirements by assess the effectiveness and accuracy of data source and data gathering techniques 
Apply advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to validate the findings, build, maintain and improve as iterative approach 
Coordinate with various teams to implement models 
Develop experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses 
Identify opportunities such as discovering new patterns form large data sets, and find solutions hidden in large data sets to improve the features/applications and find new features/applications 
Define the validity of data such as how the information is meaningful, and what other information it is related to 
Ensure the data is in compliance with the regulatory and security policies in place 
Develop usage and access control policies and systems in collaboration with other data related departments
Provide ongoing tracking and monitoring of performance of the statistical models, recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information 
Lead the design and deployment of enhancements and fixes to systems as needed 
Present and depict the rationale of the findings in easy to understand terms to the research team and to the management 
Educate the team (CAV research and IT department) on new approaches, such as testing hypotheses and statistical validation of results 

Education Required 

Master’s or PhD degree (Preferred) in any one of the following disciplines, or in a similar discipline:

Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer science or another quantitative field 



Experience/Knowledge Required ALL of the following: 

Demonstrated experience solving loosely defined problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large data sets 
2+ years’ after school practical experience with data storage and analysis tools such as Sql, Hadoop or other big data frameworks 
2+ years’ statistical modeling using tools such as Python, MATLAB, R, and/or SAS 
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics. 
Experience in statistical techniques and concepts (Properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and applying these to applications 

Preferred:

Experience with intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) or vehicular data 
Familiarity with either telematics, wireless networking, or V2V V2I communications protocols (examples: 3G, 4G LTE, 5G, UDP, IEEE802.11, CAN, V2V, V2I, V2X …) 
Experience programming within Unix-based operating systems, such as Linux 
Programming in Python 

ALL of the following: 

Have a passion to create and try new ideas 
Effective communication skills, both verbal and written 
Demonstrated ability to be productive independently or in a small team environment 
Eager to quickly learn by searching, reading, by example and trial & error 
Comfortable working in a multicultural environment 
Accept some travel 
Accept long hours on occasion 

Preferred: 

Does not mind working on new and diverse things as opposed to developing perfection in one area
